data.scheme_name: Micro, Small And Medium Enterprises Promotion Policy - 2022 - Promoting Quality Improvement among MSMEs - Existing
data.benefits:
Scheme provide assistance for: 

1. Certification costs: 25% - 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). 

2. Laboratory setup and equipment: 25% - 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). 

3. IT system acquisition: 25% - 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 2 lakh). 

4. Employee training costs: 25% - 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 0.5 lakh). 

5. Patent and GI registry: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 10 lakh) for documentation costs. Attorney fee reimbursement: Rs. 0.5 lakh for national and Rs. 2 lakh for international applications (after grant). 

6. ERP systems: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 1 lakh) for ERP system installation. 

7. ICT facilities: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh) for ICT platforms and facilities.
data.conditions:
1. Incentives under one head/ category, can only be availed under one policy. 
  2. Land cost is not eligible for fiscal incentives under the policy. 
  3. Land cost can be taken as part of fixed capital investment subject to ceiling of 10% of fixed capital investment. 
  4. Total financial assistance under the policy will be limited to the total fixed capital investment made by the unit.
data.beneficiaries:
1. All Existing MSME for Expansion/Diversification. 
  2. Eligible investment period under the policy will be 2, 3 and 4 years for micro, small and medium enterprises, respectively, from the date of application. 
  3. The units will have to start commercial production during the eligible investment period.
data.prerequisites:
1. Incentives under one head/ category, can only be availed under one policy. 
  2. Land cost is not eligible for fiscal incentives under the policy. 
  3. Land cost can be taken as part of fixed capital investment subject to ceiling of 10% of fixed capital investment. 
  4. Total financial assistance under the policy will be limited to the total fixed capital investment made by the unit.
data.nodal_agency: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Export Promotion department
data.context:
1. To position Uttar Pradesh as a top choice for national and global investors, the aim is to promote the growth of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs). 
  2. The goals include achieving 15% annual growth in new businesses, generating maximum employment, and boosting jobs by 15% through the expansion and upgrading of existing units.
data.objective:
1. The goal is to support new MSMEs by offering financial assistance based on their investment in plant, machinery, and equipment (excluding land costs). 
  2. The assistance varies by enterprise size and region and is paid in two installments as the project progresses, encouraging MSME growth in the state.
data.description:
Scheme provide assistance for: 

1. Certification costs: Micro enterprises: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). Small enterprises: 50% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). Medium enterprises: 25% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). 

2. Laboratory setup and equipment: Micro enterprises: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). Small enterprises: 50% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). Medium enterprises: 25% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh). 

3. IT system acquisition: Micro enterprises: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 2 lakh). Small enterprises: 50% reimbursement (up to Rs. 2 lakh). Medium enterprises: 25% reimbursement (up to Rs. 2 lakh). 

4. Employee training costs: Micro enterprises: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 0.5 lakh). Small enterprises: 50% reimbursement (up to Rs. 0.5 lakh). Medium enterprises: 25% reimbursement (up to Rs. 0.5 lakh). 

5. Patent and GI registry: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 10 lakh) for documentation costs. Attorney fee reimbursement: Rs. 0.5 lakh for national and Rs. 2 lakh for international applications (after grant). 

6. ERP systems: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 1 lakh) for ERP system installation. 

7. ICT facilities: 75% reimbursement (up to Rs. 5 lakh) for ICT platforms and facilities.
data.how_to_apply:
To get financial assistance under this policy, unit has to apply through on-line mode.(Nivesh Portal)
Eligible units will have to apply to the respective District Industries and Enterprise Promotion Centre.
data.funding_facilitator: Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises and Export Promotion department, Government of Uttarpradesh
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefits after the approval of the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
This policy would not be applicable to the following investment proposals; - 1. Tobacco products, Gutka, pan masala etc.
2. Alcohol, aerated drinks, carbonated products etc.
3. Manufacturing of firecrackers; 
4. Plastic carry bags (less than 40 microns) or plastic bags of specified thickness as categorized by the state government from time to time 
5. Other products categorized in the prohibited category from time to time.
data.checklist_info_a:
1.Copy of Udyam Registration Certificate (URC)
2. Certificate of Incorporation/ Partnership deed/Partnership registration/ Co- operative society 
registration. 
3.KYC Details
data.checklist_info_d: Picup Bhawan, Block A, 4th Floor, Lucknow, UP, 0522-3117976, info@investup.org.in
data.beneficiary: Specific Industriy - All Entities - Uttar Pradesh - All MSMEs
